body:
You can check it out with:

https://rclone.org/rc/#debugging-rclone-with-pprof

And a debug log would be great.

I saved the log but it was only the standard "checking file" ad vitam eternam until there was nothing and the process got killed.

I'm not sure how to exactly show the issue as it will only be apparent on *huge* runs that are long enough to saturate a machine's RAM. I also don't have the luxury to crash my home server every 4 hours so it's hard for me to run other tests to failure.
Need the memory item I linked above if you'd like to find a cause.

Can you try setting GOGC as mentioned here and see if that improves things

https://rclone.org/faq/#rclone-is-using-too-much-memory-or-appears-to-have-a-memory-leak

It's not unusual for memory usage to go up during a sync. With a memory trace we can see if rclone is leaking objects or if it is just fragmented memory use.

Try reducing --transfers and --checkers to use less memory.

In a sync the number of items in the largest directory usually controls the max memory usage. How many do you think that is?

> Need the memory item I linked above if you'd like to find a cause. Running it with `watch -n 600 go tool pprof -text http://localhost:5572/debug/pprof/heap` right now, will share the logs folder once it's a bit fuller. Also paired it with `export GOGC=20`.
Expand to see logs after 10 minutes ``` File: rclone Type: inuse_space Time: Feb 27, 2022 at 10:38am (JST) Showing nodes accounting for 234.62MB, 95.41% of 245.89MB total Dropped 96 nodes (cum <= 1.23MB) flat flat% sum% cum cum% 178.58MB 72.62% 72.62% 178.58MB 72.62% github.com/buengese/sgzip.NewWriterLevel.func1 40MB 16.27% 88.89% 40MB 16.27% github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress.(*Fs).rcat 8MB 3.25% 92.15% 8MB 3.25% path.Join 3MB 1.22% 93.37% 3MB 1.22% encoding/json.(*decodeState).literalStore 2MB 0.81% 94.18% 2MB 0.81% fmt.Sprintf 1.50MB 0.61% 94.79% 1.50MB 0.61% github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress.(*Fs).newObjectSizeAndNameOnly (inline) 1MB 0.41% 95.20% 3MB 1.22% github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/drive.(*Fs).newRegularObject 0.54MB 0.22% 95.41% 9.04MB 3.68% github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/drive.(*Fs).List.func1 0 0% 95.41% 174.96MB 71.15% bytes.(*Reader).WriteTo 0 0% 95.41% 3MB 1.22% encoding/json.(*Decoder).Decode 0 0% 95.41% 3MB 1.22% encoding/json.(*decodeState).array 0 0% 95.41% 3MB 1.22% encoding/json.(*decodeState).object 0 0% 95.41% 3MB 1.22% encoding/json.(*decodeState).unmarshal 0 0% 95.41% 3MB 1.22% encoding/json.(*decodeState).value 0 0% 95.41% 176.16MB 71.64% github.com/buengese/sgzip.(*Writer).Write 0 0% 95.41% 1.85MB 0.75% github.com/buengese/sgzip.(*Writer).compressBlock 0 0% 95.41% 15.54MB 6.32% github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress.(*Fs).List 0 0% 95.41% 214.96MB 87.42% github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress.(*Fs).Put 0 0% 95.41% 2.50MB 1.02% github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress.(*Fs).addData 0 0% 95.41% 2.50MB 1.02% github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress.(*Fs).processEntries 0 0% 95.41% 40MB 16.27% github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress.(*Fs).putCompress 0 0% 95.41% 2.41MB 0.98% github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress.(*Fs).putCompress.func1 0 0% 95.41% 40MB 16.27% github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress.(*Fs).putWithCustomFunctions 0 0% 95.41% 174.96MB 71.15% github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress.checkCompressAndType 0 0% 95.41% 174.96MB 71.15% github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress.isCompressible 0 0% 95.41% 13.04MB 5.30% github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/crypt.(*Fs).List 0 0% 95.41% 12.04MB 4.90% github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/drive.(*Fs).List 0 0% 95.41% 3MB 1.22% github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/drive.(*Fs).itemToDirEntry 0 0% 95.41% 12.04MB 4.90% github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/drive.(*Fs).list 0 0% 95.41% 3MB 1.22% github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/drive.(*Fs).list.func2 0 0% 95.41% 3MB 1.22% github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/drive.(*Fs).newObjectWithInfo 0 0% 95.41% 2.50MB 1.02% github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/local.(*Fs).List 0 0% 95.41% 2.50MB 1.02% github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/local.(*Fs).cleanRemote 0 0% 95.41% 3MB 1.22% github.com/rclone/rclone/fs.pacerInvoker 0 0% 95.41% 19.04MB 7.74% github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/list.DirSorted 0 0% 95.41% 19.04MB 7.74% github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/march.(*March).makeListDir.func1 0 0% 95.41% 2.50MB 1.02% github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/march.(*March).processJob.func1 0 0% 95.41% 16.54MB 6.73% github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/march.(*March).processJob.func2 0 0% 95.41% 214.96MB 87.42% github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/operations.Copy 0 0% 95.41% 214.96MB 87.42% github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/sync.(*syncCopyMove).pairCopyOrMove 0 0% 95.41% 3MB 1.22% github.com/rclone/rclone/lib/pacer.(*Pacer).Call 0 0% 95.41% 3MB 1.22% github.com/rclone/rclone/lib/pacer.(*Pacer).call 0 0% 95.41% 3MB 1.22% google.golang.org/api/drive/v3.(*FilesListCall).Do 0 0% 95.41% 3MB 1.22% google.golang.org/api/internal/gensupport.DecodeResponse (inline) 0 0% 95.41% 176.16MB 71.64% io.Copy (inline) 0 0% 95.41% 176.16MB 71.64% io.copyBuffer 0 0% 95.41% 4.13MB 1.68% runtime.doInit 0 0% 95.41% 4.63MB 1.88% runtime.main 0 0% 95.41% 179.22MB 72.88% sync.(*Pool).Get ```
Expand to see the atop data just before my latest crash I ran `rclone` against last night. It got to 15.4Gb RAM usage and crashed the machine again:
> Can you try setting GOGC as mentioned here and see if that improves things Trying it as we speak! > Try reducing --transfers and --checkers to use less memory. Using default values on a 16Gb machine, I feel like it should not be an issue. > In a sync the number of items in the largest directory usually controls the max memory usage. How many do you think that is? Normally nothing crazy. I'm dumping millions of files but each directory should be of a reasonable size.

Here is the output of `pprof` after running for one hour:

```
File: rclone
Type: inuse_space
Time: Feb 27, 2022 at 11:58am (JST)
Showing nodes accounting for 4.60GB, 98.73% of 4.65GB total
Dropped 134 nodes (cum <= 0.02GB)
      flat  flat%   sum%        cum   cum%
    4.54GB 97.47% 97.47%     4.54GB 97.47%  github.com/buengese/sgzip.NewWriterLevel.func1
    0.06GB  1.26% 98.73%     0.06GB  1.28%  github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress.(*Fs).rcat
         0     0% 98.73%     4.46GB 95.77%  bytes.(*Reader).WriteTo
         0     0% 98.73%     0.03GB  0.61%  github.com/buengese/sgzip.(*Writer).Close
         0     0% 98.73%     4.48GB 96.35%  github.com/buengese/sgzip.(*Writer).Write
         0     0% 98.73%     0.06GB  1.20%  github.com/buengese/sgzip.(*Writer).compressBlock
         0     0% 98.73%     0.03GB  0.61%  github.com/buengese/sgzip.(*Writer).compressCurrent
         0     0% 98.73%     4.53GB 97.26%  github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress.(*Fs).Put
         0     0% 98.73%     0.07GB  1.45%  github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress.(*Fs).putCompress
         0     0% 98.73%     0.06GB  1.19%  github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress.(*Fs).putCompress.func1
         0     0% 98.73%     0.07GB  1.46%  github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress.(*Fs).putWithCustomFunctions
         0     0% 98.73%     4.46GB 95.82%  github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress.checkCompressAndType
         0     0% 98.73%     4.46GB 95.82%  github.com/rclone/rclone/backend/compress.isCompressible
         0     0% 98.73%     4.53GB 97.28%  github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/operations.Copy
         0     0% 98.73%     4.53GB 97.28%  github.com/rclone/rclone/fs/sync.(*syncCopyMove).pairCopyOrMove
         0     0% 98.73%     4.48GB 96.35%  io.Copy (inline)
         0     0% 98.73%     4.48GB 96.35%  io.copyBuffer
         0     0% 98.73%     4.56GB 97.91%  sync.(*Pool).Get
```

There is a very clear culprit in:
`github.com/buengese/sgzip.NewWriterLevel.func1`

The RAM usage of this node goes up and up without ever being garbage collected.

issue.title: Compress backend crashes if metadata json can't be uploaded due to user rate limit on Google Drive, likely other remotes.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`
https://forum.rclone.org/t/rclone-compress-backend-crashes-when-user-rate-limit-is-expired-and-the-json-metadata-cant-be-saved/29284


#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
I'm trying to upload a single filesystem snapshot to a google drive remote which is 800GB in size. This obviously exceeds the daily user rate limit. The initial file does upload successfully, however is seems when the compress backend attempts to save it's metadata, even when low-level retries is set to 9999999, this fails with rclone crashing. It is interesting that the retries is only 1/1, even with a more sane number of low-level retries set


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
```
rclone v1.57.0-DEV

os/version: centos 8 (64 bit)
os/kernel: 4.18.0-358.el8.x86_64 (x86_64)
os/type: linux
os/arch: amd64
go/version: go1.16.12
go/linking: dynamic
go/tags: none
```


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
Centos Stream Linux 64bit


#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)
Google Drive


#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
```
nice zfs send -c -w -v $newsnap 2>/root/zfssend-$volume.log | nice rclone --low-level-retries=99999999 --retries-sleep 30m --config=/etc/rclone.conf --log-level=DEBUG --log-file=/root/rclonezfs-$volume.log rcat server-backup-compress:zfs/$server/$newsnap-$frequency
```


#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
```
2022/02/13 23:30:15 DEBUG : vcm513adva5gj07l0gm8bs7kg0vbvog5bee7fjskjl6t5gsiav88pt3k3uu3p6sebkojv97990n2q8e9n5snqhib83l0tjsd531lb0r5hk4u2dk6p1krgr1mdu7ppeqbj2makhd7p5kj2d89h2rugvam30: Sending chunk 873488973824 length 8388608

2022/02/13 23:30:19 DEBUG : init_vms@zfs-auto-snap_frequent-2022-02-13-1915-yearly.__________8.gz: md5 = b43320ad5256a418080e64446fb8eb6c OK
2022/02/13 23:30:20 INFO  : init_vms@zfs-auto-snap_frequent-2022-02-13-1915-yearly.__________8.gz.splt.001_9hxa9v: Moved (server-side) to: init_vms@zfs-auto-snap_frequent-2022-02-13-1915-yearly.__________8.gz
```

<!--- Please keep the note below for others who read your bug report. -->

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the  [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.

body:
> There is a very clear culprit in: `github.com/buengese/sgzip.NewWriterLevel.func1`

Ah ha! A smoking gun! Well done :-) It looks like the `isCompressible` function never closes the compressor which would explain the memory leak.

Can you try this fix?

[v1.58.0-beta.6009.f2d7985e5.fix-6013-compress-memory](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-6013-compress-memory/v1.58.0-beta.6009.f2d7985e5.fix-6013-compress-memory/) on branch [fix-6013-compress-memory](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-6013-compress-memory) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
@ncw I'm not seeing a Linux amd64 build unfortunately. Do you know what that could be due to?

I re-ran the build as it locked up :-(

Hopefully it will be OK this time.
Looks like it worked this time and made binaries for you to try @mrtolkien
Did you get a chance to try the binaries @mrtolkien ?
I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.58
I did download and run it, and it seems fixed! Thanks a lot for the quick fix.
